timestamps.1002: CSS algorithms in the real world: Larva Framework (alpha)
timestamps.1282: How to write a CSS algorithm

timestamps.60: Takeaway #1: CSS variables work like normal CSS properties
timestamps.351: Takeaway #2: CSS variables are inherited properties (but you can change that)
timestamps.685: Takeaway #4: Invalid at computed-value time = initial
timestamps.923: Takeaway #5: Cycles make variables invalid at computed-value time
timestamps.1035: Takeaway #6: Use variables for pure data, not CSS values
timestamps.1855: Takeaway #8: CSS variables enable theming independent of CSS structure
timestamps.2079: Takeaway #9: Default default values are possible
timestamps.2200: Takeaway #10: CSS variables make responsive design easier
timestamps.2259: Takeaway #11: CSS variables enable you to set multiple properties at once
timestamps.2366: Takeaway #12: CSS variables let you create single property mixins (like function carrying, in programmerese)
timestamps.2539: Takeaway #13: CSS variables enable you to define your own longhand properties
timestamps.2690: Takeaway #15: CSS variables are a revolution for separation of style and behaviour
